(53) 27913th October, 1953Copy No.CABINETTHE QUEEN'S SPEECH ON THE PROROGATION OF parliament note by the Chancellor of the exchequer circulate herewith, for the consideration of the Cabinet, a draft of the queen's Speech on the Prorogation of Parliament.R. A. B.Treasury Chambers, S.W. 1,13th October, 1953.45001Printed for the Cabinet. October 1953 DRAFT OF THE QUEEN'S SPEECH ON THE PROROGATION OFPARLIAMENTMy Lords and Members of the House of commons. I acknowledge with deep gratitude the expressions of loyalty and devotionwhich marked My Coronation and the prayers of My Peoples which sustainedMe on that solemn occasion. The presence of so many leading representativesof the Commonwealth and Empire and of other countries was an added source of support and happiness to Me and My dear Husband.2. My Government have continued their wholehearted support of theUnited Nations.3. In Korea My Forces played a notable part in the successful resistance to aggresion. I received with deep thankfulness the news of the armistice whichbrought the fighting to an end. My Government have continued to work with others in seeking a peaceful settlement of the Korean problem.4. In Malaya My Forces, together with the local security forces, have been increasingly successful in their campaign. I have watched with sympathy andadmiration the gallant efforts of My loyal subjects of all races in Kenya to restorepeace and order in that country.5. My Government have continued in the North Atlantic Treaty organisation to develop the combined strength of the West.6. My Government have given full support and encouragement to the pro-motion of European unity and prosperity. They have offered to enter into closepolitical and military relations with the European Defence Community and have continued to take a leading part in the work of the Organisation for european economic Co-operation.7. My Government and the Governments of France and the United States have invited the Soviet Government to a meeting to discuss the problem of Germanyand to conclude the Austrian State Treaty. Communications with the SovietGovernment about this proposal are still continuing.8. My Government have been discussing with the Egyptian Governmentmeans of settling the differences between the two countries while safeguarding thesecurity of the Middle East and the Suez Canal.9. My Government have signed with the United Kingdom of Libya a Treatyof Friendship and Alliance which provides for mutual defence and recognises thecommon interest of the two countries in the maintenance of international peace and security.10. Prime Ministers of the Commonwealth met in London last november and again immediately after My Coronation. At their first Conference they agreed on a course of action to strengthen the economies of Commonwealth countries,to bring about by international agreement more rapid progress towards freer tradeand currencies and to maintain the improvement in the balance of payments of the sterling area. At their second Conference the Prime Ministers reviewed the inter-national situation and considered what contributibn Commonwealth governments could make towards composing the differences which divide the world.11. An Act was passed conferring on Me powers, which I have exercised, toprovide for a Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland. I earnestly hope that aharmonious and prosperous future lies before the new Federation.12. The peoples of My Colonial territories and protectorates are moving towards a larger share in the management of their own affairs within the Common-wealth. My Ministers have held discussions with representatives of the peoples of Nigeria on the future of their Constitution. A further step has been taken towards Federation in the.West. Indies. My Government are considering proposalsfor the future constitutional advance of the Gold Coast. 13. The orderly development and rearmament of My Forces has continue during the year.14. I grieved at the loss of life and destruction from the recent severe earth-quake in Cyprus and rejoiced that My Forces were able to bring rapid aid to the victims of a like calamity in Greece.Members of the House of Commons15. I thank you for the provision which you have made for the Public Services.My Lords and Members of the House of Commons16. I was greatly distressed by the widespread damage and suffering causedby the storm and floods on the East Coast of England and in Scotland. my government took energetic measures to provide relief and will meet the full cost of restoring the damaged sea defences. This work is now largely complete and incertain areas excellent progress had been made with major improvements.Emergency legislation was passed to facilitate this work in England and to givefinancial assistance for the restoration of flooded land.17. Legislation has provided for the continuance of grants for new fishing vessels and of assistance to the fishing industries.18. All concerned with the land have worked resolutely in response to my government^ call to increase food production. Cereals and feeding-stuffs havebeen released from control and a new method of guaranteeing the return which the farmer receives has been introduced for 1954.19. Building and the production of building materials have alike increased and My Ministers have continued to expand their building programme.20. Measures have been passed to make further financial provision for thebuilding of new towns and to provide for the revaluation of dwelling houses for rating purposes, to abolish development charges, and to improve the superannuationbenefits available to local government officers.21. I have given My assent to a measure to establish an Iron and Steel board for the supervision of the iron and steel industry and to provide for the resale of iron and steel undertakings.22. An Act has been passed which amends the powers, duties and composition of the British Transport Commission and provides for the return to free enterpriseof the long distance carriage of goods by road, for the reorganisation of the railwaysand for greater freedom for the Commission in the charges they may make.23. Legislation has been passed to improve the maternity benefits under national Insurance and the working of the Industrial Injuries Scheme.24. An Act has been passed to amend the provisions of the Education Actsincluding those relating to voluntary schools.25. A measure has been passed to enable grants to be made towards thepreservation of buildings of outstanding historic and architectural importance andto strengthen the legislative provisions for the protection of Ancient Monuments.26. I have given My assent to measures to strengthen the monopolies commission and the law relating to merchandise marks.27. With the object of promoting administrative efficiency and publiceconomy My Government have merged the Ministry of Civil Aviation with theMinistry of Transport and the Ministry of Pensions with the Ministry of national insurance.28. I thank you for the zeal with which you have discharged your arduouslabours and I pray that they may be rewarded by the blessing of Almighty God.
